raw_comment: In this graph I notice that in most countries the percentages for 15-24 year olds are higher than those who are older than 40. I wonder what about the people who are in between the ages of 24 and 40. Did they get a say? How would the graph differ if their responses were present? I also wonder how each country is different and how this affects the responses? Like the government, does that affect the way people see the world? This relates to me and my community because there are many people in my life in both of these age groups, so I can wonder how all of them would respond. My catchy headline: "Who has hope for the future?"
ace_sentences: In most countries, the percentages for 15-24 year olds are higher than the percentages for people who are older than 40.
I wonder about people who are between 24 years and 40 years.
I ask whether these people had a say.
I ask how the graph would differ if the responses of these people were present.
I wonder how each country is different.
I wonder how the differences between countries affect the responses.
A government is an institution of a country.
I ask whether the government of a country affects the way people see the world.
This comment relates to me and my community.
There are many people in my life who are 15-24 year olds.
There are many people in my life who are older than 40.
I wonder how all of these people would respond.
The headline is: Who has hope for the future?
